page.title: 06FEATURES OF THE AREA
page.content: Blackpool is probably Britain's leading resort which entertains millions of visitors each year. The town is geared to the holiday industry, with little else in the way of employment, and is dominated by hotels, guest houses and shops and facilities to cater for its visitors. The sea front extends for a five mile stretch, and caters for every one - with a tower, three piers and a large pleasure-beach dominating the front. The season is extended by the "Illuminations" which carry on until late October, and insures Blackpool is busy long after other holiday resorts are empty. Blackpool, like many holiday resorts, has a high percentage of pensioners as many people have moved into the area to enjoy their retirement here.
